page.title: 11RESCOBIE LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Rescobie Parish has considerable{Local {History.}It has been called Rescolpyne, Rescolbyne and Rescolpin. The Res- seems to come from Ros- meaning "a promontory". -Cobie comes from Sgolb meaning "the point of the thorny place or wood". The Picts have left their traces at Rescobie. Rob's Reed is an{Ancient {Fort}built by the Picts. It is situated on Pitscandly Hill but all that are left are a few foundation stones which are in a circle and covered by grass. The Standing Stones at Blackgate are probably{Memorials}to Pictish chiefs who were slain at a battle in 831A.D. There were originally 4 or more stones but there are only 2 now. One had an urn full of calcined human bones at its base. There is also the site of a{Souterrain along the dismantled railway.
